gameLogic.goal

Class Goal

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameLogic.goal.Goal

  • public class Goal
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is a goal that is added to a player and repeatedly (?) checked for completion.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Goal(Station origin, Station destination, int turn, java.util.List<Station> idealRoute)
      Instantiation method also generates a score value.

      Sets the origin of the goal.

      Checks whether the goal is complete when a train arrives at a station.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Goal

        public Goal(Station origin,
    Station destination,
    int turn,
    java.util.List<Station> idealRoute)
        Instantiation method also generates a score value.
        Parameters:
        origin - The first location of the goal.
        destination - The destination location of the goal.
        turn - The turn in which the goal was issued.
        idealRoute - the idealRoute for solving this goal

    • Method Detail

      • addConstraint

        public void addConstraint(ResourceManager resourceManager,
                 java.lang.String name,
                 java.lang.Object value)
        This method adds a constraint to the goal. If there is a conflict (e.g. TrainType vs. TurnCount) then the constraints are adjusted.
        Parameters:
        resourceManager - The game ResourceManager.
        name - The name of the constraint to be added.
        value - The value of the constraint to be added.

      • getRewardScore

        public int getRewardScore()
        Returns:
        The rewards score for completing this goal.

      • isComplete

        public boolean isComplete(Train train)
        Checks whether the goal is complete when a train arrives at a station.
        Parameters:
        train - The train that has just arrived at a station.
        Returns:
        True if the goal is complete, false otherwise.

      • isFailed

        public boolean isFailed()
        This method checks whether the goal has failed on turns. If the turnCount is less than <= 0, it returns true, otherwise false.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Produces a String representation of the Goal.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

        public void setComplete()
        Sets the complete boolean

        Returns whether the goal is complete.
